intro: Palicourea irrasiflora, commonly known as the pink-flowered palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered pink or white flowers and elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
